我估佢而家最想係playoff 贏火箭，復仇

Stephen Curry is a Taurus whereas his girlfriend is an Aquarius. I find the Japanese culture very different than the Chinese culture. We enjoy yum cha while they enjoy drinking green tea and watching baseball at bars rather than at home, soaking up the atmosphere. Stephen is faithful to his girlfriend and would never cheat on her. When he broke up with his ex, he was driven over the edge. Even when a stranger talked to him there was a definite edge of hostility in his voice. But as soon as he had a new relationship target it took the edge of his emotional upset. His ex was a swimming champion who easily outshines us in any swimming styles. She's tall and shapely who definitely has the edge over lots of swimmers. Recently, Stephen was in a brawl with a guy who was hitting on his girlfriend. The police showed up later and jealousy was assigned as the motive for the brawl. Last Sunday they dined in a restaurant in a hotel which is midway between his place and the post office. They waited in line for almost an hour outside the restaurant. The line was so huge that it stretched from the counter through the lobby area and out the main entrance of the hotel. A stout man tried to cut in line but was caught. Yesterday i visited Stephen's place. We met at a midway point between his place and mine then he took me to the shuttle bus bound for his place. A group of people was in the way near the bus stop so he said "excuse me" The queue was so big stretching down the road to the furthest mini bus stop. We queued for half an hour until three shuttle buses came along at once. Meanwhile some people mistook this long queue for the queue for other places. A couple came up to us and asked "are you in the queue for Cluny Park?" as they wanna be sure that it's the right queue. A burly man pushed in at the head of the queue. Later a stout guy jumped the queue. The lady behind him said "excuse me. The end of the line is back there" A woman stood beside a guy who was midway through the queue. While pretending to look at her phone she edged furtively behind him who didn't realise she was there. Some people might have noticed it but ignored it. Stephen seemed on edge. It turns out he has a job interview next week. Never has he felt so on edge before an interview. Stephen's elder brother is currently a head chef at a five-star hotel and feels he's found his niche. His younger brother has also found his niche as a professor, having worked as a researcher for three years. He sometimes has a snooze at lunchtime because he has so much work to do that he feels drained. He usually naps at his desk or on the sofa by the fireplace when everyone else is eating lunch outside. He once brought his work along to the library where I saw him doze off at the table. Having a doze especially by the fire is a marvellous to replenish your energy though. His eldest brother has just completed his PhD at Peking University and is on the way to becoming a professor. Japan is on the way to becoming the world's strongest economy. His elder sister is robust and healthy. She does lots of strength and conditioning exercise in her robust sneakers. After her gym session she usually drinks a cup of robust coffee and a glass of robust wine. She lives in Korea where the political system and the economy are robust. His younger sister has opened an antique shop which made a favourable impression on me. There's an exquisite antique which engages my interest. I bet you the store engages lots of passers-by. I got a good impression of the shop. Stephen's uncle has recently passed away at the age of ninety nine. I offer my sincere condolences to his uncle's family. His friend said "My condolences on the loss of your uncle" His mum sent her condolences to his uncle's family too. His dad wrote "Our condolences go to his family" Stephen hadn't heard from his cousin for years until yesterday when he received a call from his cousin. They chatted in exquisite delight.

Stephen Curry's cousin said there was a bully in his class so Stephen told his cousin not to engage with him. Just stay out of his way as much as possible. Stephen lives in the most exclusive and expensive area in Tokyo and owns many houses. Unlike Floyd, he's never ostentatious though extremely wealthy. You can find out how ostentatious Floyd's lifestyle is on YouTube such as his car and house collections. He always wears ostentatious jewellery such as gold necklaces, rings and silver bracelets. He loves driving flashy cars and wearing flashy clothes. Do you remember the incident in Langham Place where the escalator stopped and reversed direction at a speed three times as fast as normal, causing people to fall and pile up at the base of the escalator? People were screaming as they tumbled down the escalator. Some people managed to grab the handrail and steady themselves. The incident occasioned a good deal of worry. When you were in secondary school were there any subjects that you weren't interested in and so didn't engage much during the classes? I remember I didn't really engage in geography classes. I was often daydreaming. These days many students learn piano, violin, painting, Japanese, judo and dancing. I honestly don't how how they juggle these activities with their schoolwork. Some of their parents have to go to work every day and so find it hard to juggle a career and a family. Perhaps they want to kindle their children's interest and see which one they have a talent for or can cultivate an interest in. Sometimes I wonder if the kids are truly enjoying their activities. Stephen loves video games. I remember him playing Counterstrike in which he used a gun to engage ninety nine enemies who only had knives lol. I'm reading a book called Parallel Worlds written by physicist Kaku. When he was explaining the theories promoting the book on a television show it captured my attention. It's a fascinating book which explores the science of time travel, wormholes, parallel universes and eleven dimensional hyperspace, subjects which engage numerous readers around the world. I find the subject of the big bang most engaging. It was an international bestseller for many months. Do you prefer indoor or outdoor pursuits? I think you have lots of opportunities for leisure pursuits. Why don't you join the army and serve a four-month tour of duty somewhere outside Hong Kong? Perhaps two tours; one in Japan, the other Malaysia. My friend Peter has just completed a seven-month tour of duty in South Korea. Dr. Chan is touring nationwide. After that he'll be making a one-week tour of Malaysia. Do you wanna attend his talk next Tuesday which will be his second leg of his nationwide tour? Joey is on tour in Asia. She'll be performing next week in Singapore on the fourth leg of her Asia tour. Also I'm thinking of joining the gym. The staff will take me on a guided tour of the facilities there. Would you like to join too? I wanna go on a walking tour or a cycling tour of Tokyo. We could have a tour guide take us on a tour of the museums and other tourist spots there. We could go on a sightseeing tour of the nearby cities like Osaka as well. Do you know how many impressions of the bible old testament there have been? By the way, I feel like going to get ice cream - wanna come? What perfume are you wearing? Do you spray yourself with perfume every morning? Some people prefer to put a few drops of perfume on their skin while others prefer to dab some perfume on their clothes. I used to live in Tokyo. I still remember my maid taking me to trick or treat but after we moved to where I now live we didn't go trick or treating anymore as it isn't popular in here.

今年的入樽大賽可以說是史上最強之一，哥頓和鍾斯的巔峰對決讓人大飽眼福，但是外界也對哥頓的失利感到惋惜，特別是的評委的打分。

作為今年NBA全明星入樽大賽的評委之一，柏賓今天做客《The Jump》節目，並透露了阿隆-哥頓在入樽大賽上失利的原因。

哥頓和鍾斯在決賽中的對決，前三輪，他們都得到50分。第四輪，鍾斯得到48分，哥頓得到47分，1分之差失利。

據柏賓透露，當時五位評論已經達成一個默契，就是讓哥頓的總得分與鍾斯打平。

“以下我說的都是事實，我要讓全世界都知道到底發生了什麼。我們之間達成了一點默契，但是不知道為什麼，當我們輸入比分之後，最終出來的結果錯了。”柏賓說道，“我們搞砸了。現實的情況是，我們以為他倆最後一輪的得分是一樣的（都是48分）。”


柏賓隨後補充道：“我試圖算清楚比分，但是我的數學真的不好。”

第四輪，柏賓給哥頓的評分是9分，而哥頓的最後總得分是47分，比鍾斯少1分。當皮蓬髮現總分不對之後，他試圖把自己給哥頓的評分改成10分，但是積分器已鎖定，改不了了。

當被問到一開始為什麼給哥頓9分，柏賓解釋說，雖然哥頓最後一扣是飛過塔科-法爾完成入樽，但是當哥頓越過法爾的時候，法爾明顯彎腰了，所以嚴格上說哥頓並沒有真正飛躍法爾。

The Top 5 this week in the 2019-20 Kia Race to the MVP Ladder
1. Giannis Antetokounmpo, Milwaukee Bucks
Season stats: 29.7 points, 13.7 rebounds, 5.8 assists, 1.1 steals, 1.1 blocks
Even when it looks like a team has figured out a way to slow Antetokounmpo down – as was the case with the Raptors on Tuesday night – “The Greek Freak” still finds a way to get his work done. He finished with 19 points, 19 rebounds, eight assists and three blocks as the Bucks won in Toronto for their 50th win of the season. The Bucks are running away from the crowd in the standings down the stretch, the same way Antetokounmpo is attempting to in the MVP chase.

2. LeChina James, Los Angeles Lakers
Season stats: 25.5 points, 7.7 rebounds, 10.6 assists, 1.2 steals
A sore groin kept LeBron in street clothes for Thursday’s game against the Golden State Warriors. He made his point earlier in the week anyway, dropping a season-high 40 points (along with eight rebounds, six assists and a block) on the New Orleans Pelicans in his first matchup with Zion Williamson, the heir apparent to his throne as the league’s biggest physical mismatch at his position.

3. James Harden, Houston Rockets
Season stats: 35.2 points, 6.4 rebounds, 7.3 assists, 1.7 steals
Harden flirted with that 40-point scoring average for so long earlier this season that he spoiled everyone with his relentless pursuit. But what might be even more impressive is the transition he’s made during this season, adjusting to the small-ball attack and continuing to make defenses miserable trying to contain him.

4. Kawhi Leonard, LA Clippers
Season stats: 27.1 points, 7.5 rebounds, 5.2 assists, 1.8 steals
The Clippers have new additions to integrate into the rotation in Marcus Morris and Reggie Jackson, but the onus for this team’s fate are planted firmly on Leonard’s broad shoulders. Things look good so far, though, with Leonard in a nice groove (24 points and 14 rebounds in a win Wednesday against Phoenix) and the newbies filling their roles perfectly (Jackson and Morris both nailed critical 3-pointers in the fourth quarter of that game).

5. Luka Doncic, Dallas Mavericks
Season stats: 28.7 points, 9.6 rebounds, 8.7 assists, 1.0 steals
Doncic celebrated his 21st birthday early and in style, collecting his 21st triple-double in a win over the San Antonio Spurs on Wednesday. Doncic needed just 119 career games to tie the Mavs’ triple-double franchise record that Jason Kidd set in 500 career games. It’s just the latest sign that Doncic is on a career trajectory that suggests he’ll win an MVP (and other accolades, too) someday.

6. Nikola Jokic, Denver Nuggets
7. Jayson Tatum, Boston Celtics
8. Anthony Davis, Los Angeles Lakers
9. Jimmy Butler, Miami Heat

T-10. Russell Westbrook, Houston Rockets
11. Bradley Beal, Washington Wizards
12. Rudy Gobert, Utah Jazz
13. Damian Lillard, Portland Trail Blazers
14. Khris Middleton, Milwaukee Bucks

quote.msg:
The Top 5 this week in the 2019-20 Kia Race to the MVP Ladder
1. Giannis Antetokounmpo, Milwaukee Bucks
Season stats: 29.7 points, 13.7 rebounds, 5.8 assists, 1.1 steals, 1.1 blocks
Even when it looks like a team has figured out a way to slow Antetokounmpo down – as was the case with the Raptors on Tuesday night – “The Greek Freak” still finds a way to get his work done. He finished with 19 points, 19 rebounds, eight assists and three blocks as the Bucks won in Toronto for their 50th win of the season. The Bucks are running away from the crowd in the standings down the stretch, the same way Antetokounmpo is attempting to in the MVP chase.

2. LeChina James, Los Angeles Lakers
Season stats: 25.5 points, 7.7 rebounds, 10.6 assists, 1.2 steals
A sore groin kept LeBron in street clothes for Thursday’s game against the Golden State Warriors. He made his point earlier in the week anyway, dropping a season-high 40 points (along with eight rebounds, six assists and a block) on the New Orleans Pelicans in his first matchup with Zion Williamson, the heir apparent to his throne as the league’s biggest physical mismatch at his position.

3. James Harden, Houston Rockets
Season stats: 35.2 points, 6.4 rebounds, 7.3 assists, 1.7 steals
Harden flirted with that 40-point scoring average for so long earlier this season that he spoiled everyone with his relentless pursuit. But what might be even more impressive is the transition he’s made during this season, adjusting to the small-ball attack and continuing to make defenses miserable trying to contain him.

4. Kawhi Leonard, LA Clippers
Season stats: 27.1 points, 7.5 rebounds, 5.2 assists, 1.8 steals
The Clippers have new additions to integrate into the rotation in Marcus Morris and Reggie Jackson, but the onus for this team’s fate are planted firmly on Leonard’s broad shoulders. Things look good so far, though, with Leonard in a nice groove (24 points and 14 rebounds in a win Wednesday against Phoenix) and the newbies filling their roles perfectly (Jackson and Morris both nailed critical 3-pointers in the fourth quarter of that game).

5. Luka Doncic, Dallas Mavericks
Season stats: 28.7 points, 9.6 rebounds, 8.7 assists, 1.0 steals
Doncic celebrated his 21st birthday early and in style, collecting his 21st triple-double in a win over the San Antonio Spurs on Wednesday. Doncic needed just 119 career games to tie the Mavs’ triple-double franchise record that Jason Kidd set in 500 career games. It’s just the latest sign that Doncic is on a career trajectory that suggests he’ll win an MVP (and other accolades, too) someday.

6. Nikola Jokic, Denver Nuggets
7. Jayson Tatum, Boston Celtics
8. Anthony Davis, Los Angeles Lakers
9. Jimmy Butler, Miami Heat
T-10. Pascal Siakam, Toronto Raptors
T-10. Russell Westbrook, Houston Rockets
11. Bradley Beal, Washington Wizards
12. Rudy Gobert, Utah Jazz
13. Damian Lillard, Portland Trail Blazers
14. Khris Middleton, Milwaukee Bucks
15. Chris Paul, Oklahoma City Thunder

quote.msg: Stephen Curry's cousin said there was a bully in his class so Stephen told his cousin not to engage with him. Just stay out of his way as much as possible. Stephen lives in the most exclusive and expensive area in Tokyo and owns many houses. Unlike Floyd, he's never ostentatious though extremely wealthy. You can find out how ostentatious Floyd's lifestyle is on YouTube such as his car and house collections. He always wears ostentatious jewellery such as gold necklaces, rings and silver bracelets. He loves driving flashy cars and wearing flashy clothes. Do you remember the incident in Langham Place where the escalator stopped and reversed direction at a speed three times as fast as normal, causing people to fall and pile up at the base of the escalator? People were screaming as they tumbled down the escalator. Some people managed to grab the handrail and steady themselves. The incident occasioned a good deal of worry. When you were in secondary school were there any subjects that you weren't interested in and so didn't engage much during the classes? I remember I didn't really engage in geography classes. I was often daydreaming. These days many students learn piano, violin, painting, Japanese, judo and dancing. I honestly don't how how they juggle these activities with their schoolwork. Some of their parents have to go to work every day and so find it hard to juggle a career and a family. Perhaps they want to kindle their children's interest and see which one they have a talent for or can cultivate an interest in. Sometimes I wonder if the kids are truly enjoying their activities. Stephen loves video games. I remember him playing Counterstrike in which he used a gun to engage ninety nine enemies who only had knives lol. I'm reading a book called Parallel Worlds written by physicist Kaku. When he was explaining the theories promoting the book on a television show it captured my attention. It's a fascinating book which explores the science of time travel, wormholes, parallel universes and eleven dimensional hyperspace, subjects which engage numerous readers around the world. I find the subject of the big bang most engaging. It was an international bestseller for many months. Do you prefer indoor or outdoor pursuits? I think you have lots of opportunities for leisure pursuits. Why don't you join the army and serve a four-month tour of duty somewhere outside Hong Kong? Perhaps two tours; one in Japan, the other Malaysia. My friend Peter has just completed a seven-month tour of duty in South Korea. Dr. Chan is touring nationwide. After that he'll be making a one-week tour of Malaysia. Do you wanna attend his talk next Tuesday which will be his second leg of his nationwide tour? Joey is on tour in Asia. She'll be performing next week in Singapore on the fourth leg of her Asia tour. Also I'm thinking of joining the gym. The staff will take me on a guided tour of the facilities there. Would you like to join too? I wanna go on a walking tour or a cycling tour of Tokyo. We could have a tour guide take us on a tour of the museums and other tourist spots there. We could go on a sightseeing tour of the nearby cities like Osaka as well. Do you know how many impressions of the bible old testament there have been? By the way, I feel like going to get ice cream - wanna come? What perfume are you wearing? Do you spray yourself with perfume every morning? Some people prefer to put a few drops of perfume on their skin while others prefer to dab some perfume on their clothes. I used to live in Tokyo. I still remember my maid taking me to trick or treat but after we moved to where I now live we didn't go trick or treating anymore as it isn't popular in here.

He finished with 19 points, 19 rebounds, eight assists and three blocks as the Bucks won in Toronto for their 50th win of the season. The Bucks are running away from the crowd in the standings down the stretch, the same way Antetokounmpo is attempting to in the MVP chase.

2. LeChina James, Los Angeles Lakers
Season stats: 25.5 points, 7.7 rebounds, 10.6 assists, 1.2 steals
A sore groin kept LeBron in street clothes for Thursday’s game against the Golden State Warriors. He made his point earlier in the week anyway, dropping a season-high 40 points (along with eight rebounds, six assists and a block) on the New Orleans Pelicans in his first matchup with Zion Williamson, the heir apparent to his throne as the league’s biggest physical mismatch at his position.

3. James Harden, Houston Rockets
Season stats: 35.2 points, 6.4 rebounds, 7.3 assists, 1.7 steals
Harden flirted with that 40-point scoring average for so long earlier this season that he spoiled everyone with his relentless pursuit. But what might be even more impressive is the transition he’s made during this season, adjusting to the small-ball attack and continuing to make defenses miserable trying to contain him.

4. Kawhi Leonard, LA Clippers
Season stats: 27.1 points, 7.5 rebounds, 5.2 assists, 1.8 steals
The Clippers have new additions to integrate into the rotation in Marcus Morris and Reggie Jackson, but the onus for this team’s fate are planted firmly on Leonard’s broad shoulders. Things look good so far, though, with Leonard in a nice groove (24 points and 14 rebounds in a win Wednesday against Phoenix) and the newbies filling their roles perfectly (Jackson and Morris both nailed critical 3-pointers in the fourth quarter of that game).

5. Luka Doncic, Dallas Mavericks
Season stats: 28.7 points, 9.6 rebounds, 8.7 assists, 1.0 steals
Doncic celebrated his 21st birthday early and in style, collecting his 21st triple-double in a win over the San Antonio Spurs on Wednesday. Doncic needed just 119 career games to tie the Mavs’ triple-double franchise record that Jason Kidd set in 500 career games. It’s just the latest sign that Doncic is on a career trajectory that suggests he’ll win an MVP (and other accolades, too) someday.
